entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 4:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Heavy Rainfall over Brooks Range and North Slope... Recent heavy rains over the Brooks Range and North Slope will see more rainfall through Sun night. Rivers and streams draining the Western and Central Brooks Range will likely see rapid rises, including the Colville River. Residents with items near river and stream edges should monitor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 2:32PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Monday Morning... Elevated surf is expected through this weekend with onshore winds. Tides are expected to be 1 to 3 feet above normal at high tide with the highest tides along the southwestern facing beaches of the Seward Peninsula and Point Hope. Flooding is not expected but waves will wash up on the beach and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 2:32PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall over the Brooks Range and Upper Kobuk Valley... Another front will move into the Brooks Range tonight with heavy rainfall continuing into Monday morning. An additional 1 to 2 inches of rainfall is possible. Streams and rivers will likely see sharp rises with some small stream flooding possible. Residents with items near river and stream edges should monitor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 4:25PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BERG GLACIER DAMMED LAKE IS RELEASING AND COULD CAUSE HIGH WATER IN CONTROLLER BAY AND NEARBY COASTAL WATERS... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova has released at some point between August 8th and 15th. This lake releases downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. Though a volume
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeast Prince William Sound
